meanings.definition: Cause (an action or process) to begin.
meanings.sent1: The loud music catalyzed the dance party.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's encouragement catalyzed the students' interest in science.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain catalyzed a spontaneous indoor picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her smile catalyzed a chain reaction of happiness among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock's loud ring catalyzed everyone to wake up early.

meanings.definition: Accelerate (a reaction) by acting as a catalyst.
meanings.sent1: The enzyme catalyzed the breakdown of food in the stomach.
meanings.sent2: The presence of sunlight catalyzed the growth of plants in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The new software update catalyzed a faster processing speed on the computer.
meanings.sent4: His words catalyzed a change in her perspective on the situation.
meanings.sent5: The spark plug catalyzed the ignition of the engine.
